PLACEMENT SERVICE
PAGE 2
Eeb. 5. Position desired: Production Manager, Program Director or
Producer-Director. Bachelor of Arts Degree - Major in Speech and
Theatre Arts. Over four and one-half years experience in radio and
television. Radio - Staff announcer, Sports Director, Program
Director. Television - Staff announcer, Producer-Director, Contin¬
uity Director. Prefer position in Northeast section of United States.
Feb. 6. Producer-Director position desired by Technical Director
of large* commercial television station. Background includes, work
as television cameraman with New York network station, training m
the production of documentary and educational films, and a liberal
arts degree from a top university.
Feb. 7. I am a graduate of the Television Workshop of New York.
I took a 480 hour course in Studio Operations, I graduated on
August 25, 1954, and I am applying for a. j.ob as a Television Studio
•Technician. I am qualified to work as a cameraman, video operator,
mike boom operator, audio and turntables and as a floor manager.
I studied Remot'e OperationsLighting and Special Effects, Scenic
Labs and Film Labs; also, 60 hours of Theory and Terminology.
Feb. 8. Now employed in commercial radio-television station,
desire to enter educational radio-television. Wide experience at
several. Eastern''radio stations, including two 50kw stations, and
at two television stations, one VHF, one UIIF. Harvard S.3. and an
AM in English. Taught English eight years, six in college,, two
in prep school. Free-lance writing nationally andregionally.
Would be good supervising students in college station, warned,
3,4. Need at least $5000 a year.
Feb. 9. Intelligent, original young woman with extensive artistic
and scientific background, interested in educational research,
broadcasting, or production. Willing and able to begin at secre¬
tarial level.
Feb. 10. Experienced announcer, director, producer, now in com¬
mercial recording, wishes to return to TV. Desires position
demanding good work, but giving responsibilitjr and freedom of
execution. Two years of "on camera" work as commercial announcer,
supplemented by responsibility of•completely producing many of
shows handled. Proficient technician who can also think.
